record.description: [Photographic copy of a] map showing the general arrangement of buildings and grounds of the World's Columbian Exposition. Grounds extended across Jackson Park and the Midway Plaisance (insert, top). The statue, "The Republic," stood at the east end of the Grand Basin on the lakefront at 64th Street, and a small copy of it now stands on the site where the Administration Building was erected. After the fair, the Grand Basin and Canal were filled in, and much of the south end of the lagoon has recently been covered over; otherwise, the wide-ranging plan of lagoons and breakwaters remains
